definition.name: NXapm_paraprobe_results_clusterer

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

symbol.name: n_ions
symbol.doc: The total number of ions in the reconstruction.

symbol.name: n_dict
symbol.doc: The total number of entries in the restricted_identifier dictionary.

definition.doc: Results of a paraprobe-clusterer tool run.

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: Version specifier of this application definition.

field.name: definition
field.doc: Official NeXus NXDL schema with which this file was written.

field.name: program
field.doc: Given name of the program/software/tool with which this NeXus (configuration) file was generated.

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: Ideally program version plus build number, or commit hash or description of ever persistent resources where the source code of the program and build instructions can be found so that the program can be configured ideally in such a manner that the result of this computational process is recreatable in the same deterministic manner.

field.name: analysis_identifier
field.doc: Ideally, a (globally persistent) unique identifier for referring to this analysis.

field.name: analysis_description
field.doc: Possibility for leaving a free-text description about this analysis.

field.name: start_time
field.doc: ISO 8601 formatted time code with local time zone offset to UTC information included when the analysis behind this results file was started, i.e. the paraprobe-tool executable started as a process.

field.name: end_time
field.doc: ISO 8601 formatted time code with local time zone offset to UTC information included when the analysis behind this results file were completed and the paraprobe-tool executable exited as a process.

field.name: config_filename
field.doc: The absolute path and name of the config file for this analysis.

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: At least SHA256 strong hash of the specific config_file for tracking provenance.

field.name: results_path
field.doc: Path to the directory where the tool should store NeXus/HDF5 results of this analysis. If not specified results will be stored in the current working directory.

field.name: status
field.doc:
A statement whether the paraprobe-tool executable managed to process the analysis or failed prematurely.
This status is written to the results file after the end_time at which point the executable must no longer compute analyses. Only when this status message is present and shows `success`, the user should consider the results. In all other cases, it might be that the executable has terminated prematurely or another error occurred.

group.doc: If used, contact information and eventually details of at least the person who performed this analysis.

Details about the coordinate system conventions used. If nothing else is specified we assume that there has to be at least one set of NXtransformations named paraprobe defined, which specifies the coordinate system. In which all positions are defined.

The individual coordinate systems which should be used. Field names should be prefixed with the following controlled terms indicating which individual coordinate system is described:
* paraprobe * lab * specimen * laser * leap * detector * recon

group.name: window
group.doc: A bitmask which identifies which of the ions in the dataset were analyzed during this process.

field.name: number_of_ions
field.doc: Number of ions covered by the mask. The mask value for most may be 0.

field.name: bitdepth
field.doc: Number of bits assumed matching on a default datatype. (e.g. 8 bits for a C-style uint8).

field.name: mask
field.doc: The unsigned integer array representing the content of the mask. If padding is used, padded bits are set to 0. The mask is for convenience always as large as the entire dataset as it will be stored compressed anyway. The convenience feature with this is that then the mask can be decoded with numpy and mirrored against the evaporation_id array and one immediately can filter out all points that were used by the paraprobe-toolbox executable. The length of the array adds to the next unsigned integer if the number of ions in the dataset is not an integer multiple of the bitdepth (padding).

group.name: cluster_analysis
group.doc: The result of a cluster analyses. These include typically the label for each ion/point documenting to which feature (if any) an ion is assigned. Typically, each analysis/run yields only a single cluster. In cases of fuzzy clustering it can be possible that an ion is assigned to multiple cluster (eventually with different) weight/probability.

group.name: dbscanID
group.doc: Results of a DBScan clustering analysis.

field.name: eps
field.doc: The epsilon (eps) parameter.

field.name: min_pts
field.doc: The minimum points (min_pts) parameter.

field.name: cardinality
field.doc: Number of members in the set which is partitioned into features. Specifically, this is the total number of targets filtered from the dataset. Cardinality here is not the total number of ions in the dataset.

field.name: identifier_offset
field.doc:
Which identifier is the first to be used to label a cluster.
The value should be chosen in such a way that special values can be resolved: * identifier_offset-1 indicates an object belongs to no cluster. * identifier_offset-2 indicates an object belongs to the noise category. Setting for instance identifier_offset to 1 recovers the commonly used case that objects of the noise category get values to -1 and unassigned points to 0. Numerical identifier have to be strictly increasing.

field.name: targets
field.doc: The evaporation sequence identifier to figure out which ions from the reconstruction were considered targets.

field.name: model_labels
field.doc: The raw labels from the DBScan clustering backend process.

field.name: core_sample_indices
field.doc: The raw array of core sample indices which specify which of the targets are core points.

field.name: numerical_label
field.doc: Matrix of numerical label for each member in the set. For classical clustering algorithms this can for instance encode the cluster_identifier.

field.name: weight
field.doc: The array of weight which specifies how surely/likely the cluster is associated/assigned to a specific identifier as is specified in the cluster_identifier array. For the DBScan and atom probe tomography the multiplicity of each ion with respect to the cluster. That is how many times should the position of the ion be accounted for because the ion is e.g. a molecular ion with several elements or isotope of requested type.

field.name: is_noise
field.doc: Optional bitmask encoding if members of the set are assigned to as noise or not.

field.name: is_core
field.doc: Optional bitmask encoding if member of the set are a core point. For details to which feature/cluster an ion/point is a core point consider numerical_label.

group.name: statistics
group.doc: In addition to the detailed storage which members was grouped to which feature/group summary statistics are stored under this group.

field.name: number_of_noise
field.doc: Total number of members in the set which are categorized as noise.

field.name: number_of_core
field.doc: Total number of members in the set which are categorized as a core point.

field.name: number_of_features
field.doc: Total number of clusters (excluding noise and unassigned).

field.name: feature_identifier
field.doc: Array of numerical identifier of each feature (cluster).

field.name: feature_member_count
field.doc: Array of number of members for each feature.

field.name: number_of_processes
field.doc: Specify if it was different from the number_of_processes in the NXcs_profiling super class.

field.name: number_of_threads
field.doc: Specify if it was different from the number_of_threads in the NXcs_profiling super class.

field.name: number_of_gpus
field.doc: Specify if it was different from the number_of_threads in the NXcs_profiling super class.
